2.title: LIFE OF THE PARTY
clues: This party was named at a Michigan convention, 1854; still going strong
In 2000 its 97,000 Florida votes left it at a Nader of popularity with Al Gore fans

Formed to oppose "King Andrew" Jackson; named after the British party for limits on royal power
In 2006 this party, no longer "progressive", came back into power in Canada
Led by Begin & Sharon, among others

3.title: LITERARY THEATRE

4.title: FRUIT
clues: A lingberry is a berry, a lingcod is a fish & a Riesling is this fruit
Tracy Chapman, Van Morrison & Bing Crosby each share a name with varieties of this fruit
A singer's mellow tones may be described as this fruit "-shaped"
The Agen, one of these dried fruits, can be eaten out of hand or stewed
(Kelly of the Clue Crew plays with her food, a peach.)  For the hardness of the endocarp, which holds the single seed, drupes, like the peach, are also called this type of fruit

5.title: DOUBLE MEANINGS
clues: The only pleas he knew about was "More Scotch, please"; you can't pass the ___ exam sitting in the ___ all day
I stared down into my ___ of latte so I wouldn't have to look at his ugly jowly ___

6.title: JAPAN-U.S. RELATIONS

In the phrase San Furanshisuko Heiwa Joyaku, a 1951 treaty, heiwa means this happy condition
1992 was a year of some tension in the relationship, symbolized by the publication of this man's novel "Rising Sun"

8.title: LANGUAGES
clues: Speakers of this language, not Spanish, answer the phone with "pronto"

Spoken by most people in Hong Kong, it has 9 tones compared to Mandarin's 4
In this language heard in & around Barcelona, the Spanish "bueno" becomes simply "bo"

9.title: BUGS
clues: A species of fire ant that reached the U.S. at this Alabama port city around 1918 has been a pest to the Southern U.S.
There are 2 kinds of this creature, soft & hard; hard ones can suck blood for weeks & cause paralysis in man & animals
These members of the family Lampyridae produce a chemical called luciferin
This "colorful" bristle-tailed insect, Lepisma saccharina, feeds on starchy items such as books & wallpaper
Beetles with this nickname can squirt a hot liquid made of hydrogen peroxide & hydroquinone

Peter Rabbit creator who said of obscene material, "I know it when I see it"
